info.description:
An Orange Business Service API for managing incidents.


### Internationalization
By default, data are in English but you can request data in French by specifying a language code in the Accept-Language header.
_Example: Accept-Language: fr_

### Resources 
- **incidents** : A incident defines an event impacting the service.
- **attachments** : Attachments defines all files associated to an incident.
- **notes** :  notes are comments on the incident written by Orange or the Customer.
- **freezePeriods** :  periods when the incident is frozen
- **aggregation** : calculate counters based on grouped attribute values.
- **status** : used to know the status of API components.
- **version** : provides the version of the API.
- **doc** : allows to download the swagger file.

### Incident API performs the following operations :
- Create or update a incident, retrieve an incident or a collection of incidents.
- Add a note, retrieve notes.
- Upload a attachment/file, list or download attachments.
- Generate statistics on incidents

### OAuth 2.0 Scopes

| Scope | Features |
| --- | --- |
| b2b:incident | Grants access to list and have details of incidents and also to report new incidents |
| b2b:incident:readonly | 	Grants access to list and have details of incidents |

***
Copyright Â© Orange Business Services 2020. All Rights Reserved.
info.title: Incident API

tags.name: Incidents
tags.description: Manage Incidents of the Orange Business Services solutions

tags.name: Notes
tags.description: A note is a comment on an incident added by the Customer staff or Orange staff.

tags.name: Attachments
tags.description: Attachments are files, documents associated to an incident or a note of an incident. These attachments can be provided by Orange staff, Orange Automatic tools or by Customers

tags.name: Freeze Periods
tags.description: Provide the list of freeze Periods

tags.name: Aggregation
tags.description: Aggregate incidents grouped by one or several attribute values.

tags.name: Miscellaneous
tags.description: Information on the API and the user.

post.description:
This operation allow to report a new incident, trouble to Orange Business Services.

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in HTTP Response 422 Unprocessable entity

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body of the POST method describing the incident

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

get.description:
This operation lists all incidents.

Filtering, pagination, sorting and partial response are available.

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in HTTP Response 422 Unprocessable entity.

parameters.name: X-API-Key
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Allow to sort the response in the order of one attribut or a list of attributs separed by a comma. To specify the descending order, the attribut must be prefixed by a '-'.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specify attributes returned by the request

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: Flag for displaying the HATEOS links of linked ressources.

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag for displaying all fields even if the value is null.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Filters incidents having Orange Single Identifier (fka. `id`) matching the requested identifier list (separated by comma). 
_example: id=20993, 33333_

parameters.name: customerReference
parameters.description: Filter the reponse by the customer reference

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by the status of the Incident. Possible Values are  `NEW`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `RESTORED`, `RESOLVED`, `CLOSED`, `ARCHIVED`, ON_HOLD, VALIDATED, DISPATCHED, UNKNOWN or a seach expression.

parameters.name: impact
parameters.description: Filter by the impact level of the Incident. Possible values are `HIGH`, `MEDIUM`, `LOW`, `UNKNOWN` or a seach expression.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Filter by the priority of the Incident. Possible values are `P1` (High Priority), `P2`, `P3`, `P4`, `P5` (Low Prioirty) and `UNKNOWN`.

parameters.name: urgency
parameters.description: Filter by the urgency level of the Incident. Possible values are `HIGH`, `MEDIUM`, `LOW`, `UNKNOWN` or a search expression.

parameters.name: serviceCondition
parameters.description: Filter by the service Condition of the Incident. Possible values are `INTERUPTED`, `BACKUP`, `LIMITED`, `DEGRADED`, `MAJOR_DEGRADED`, `TRANSPARENT`, `NO_SERVICE_IMPACT`, `OTHER` or a search expression.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by the type of the Incident. Possible value is FAILURE. Additional values will be inserted in next versions of the API.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Filter by the origin of the Incident. Possible values are `CUSTOMER`, `PROVIDER`, `PROBES`, `UNKNOWN` or a search expression.

parameters.name: shortDescription
parameters.description: Filter by shortDescription. The value can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter by description. The value can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: customer.id
parameters.description: Filter by the customer id associated to the incident. Value can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: customer.name
parameters.description: Filter by the customer name associated to the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: configurationItems.id
parameters.description: Filter by identifiers of Configuration Items impacted by the issue. Can be an exact value or a seach expression.

parameters.name: configurationItems.name
parameters.description: Filter by the names of Configuration Items impacted by the issue. Can be an exact value or a seach expression.

parameters.name: configurationItems.reference
parameters.description: Filter by references of the Configuration Items impacted by the issue. Can be an exact value or a seach expression.

parameters.name: configurationItems.customerName
parameters.description: Filter by Customer references of the Configuration Items impacted by the issue. Can be an exact value or a seach expression.

parameters.name: location.id
parameters.description: Filter the reponse by the Orange identifer of the Location. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: location.name
parameters.description: Filter by the name of the location. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: location.customerReference
parameters.description: Filter by the Customer Reference of the location. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: contacts.name
parameters.description: Filter by the Contact name associated to the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: contacts.lastname
parameters.description: Filter by the Contact last name associated to the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: contacts.firstname
parameters.description: Filter by the Contact first name associated to the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: contacts.email
parameters.description: Filter by the Contact email associated to the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.id
parameters.description: Filter by the idenfier of the Service Point.Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.reference
parameters.description: Filter by the reference of the Service Point.Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.customerReference
parameters.description: Filter by the customer reference of the Service Point. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.serviceLevelManagement.id
parameters.description: Filter by the identifier of the Service Level Management. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.serviceLevelManagement.coverageTime
parameters.description: Filter by the Coverage time of the Service Level Management. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.serviceLevelManagement.restoreTime
parameters.description: Filter by the Restore time of the Service Level Management. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: servicePoint.serviceLevelManagement.responseTime
parameters.description: Filter by the Response time of the Service Level Management. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: closureSummary.isRootCause
parameters.description: Filter by the flag if the incident is the root cause of the trouble. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: closureSummary.initialCategory
parameters.description: Filter by the initial category of the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: closureSummary.cause
parameters.description: Filter by the closure cause of the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: closureSummary.closedAt
parameters.description: Filter by closure date of the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: closureSummary.reason
parameters.description: Filter by the closure reason of the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: closureSummary.responsible
parameters.description: Filter by the responsability of the incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.openedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the opening date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.detectedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the creation date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.committedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the committed date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.resolvedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the resolving date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.restoredAt
parameters.description: Filter by the restoration date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.closedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the close date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.modifiedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the last modified date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: keyDates.validatedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the validation date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Filter by the creation date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Filter by the last update date of the Incident. Can be an exact value or a search expression.

parameters.name: isEscalated
parameters.description: TODO - Filter incidents that are escalated or not.

parameters.name: event.id
parameters.description: TODO - Filter by the identifier of the Event that generate the Incident

parameters.description: Specify additional items to add in the response

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Body of the request containing the note attributes.

Content-Location.description: URI of the new Incident Note

parameters.name: X-API-KEY

parameters.name: offset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Reduce the response

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: author.name
parameters.description: Filter by the author of the note

parameters.name: createdAt

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Filter by the origin of the item

X-Total-Count.description: The total number of items matching criterias.

post.description: This method allows to add a new attachment to an incident.It is not possible to remove or delete a document

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Orange Incident Number

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information require for upload a file.

schema.description: Attributes on the file to upload.

content.description: Content of the file encoded in Base64.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the incident

get.summary: List all Attachments of an Incident.
get.description: The method allows to retrieve the complete list of attachments of a specific incident.

parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: Orange Incident Number

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Allow to sort following one or several attributes separated by a comma. For descending order, just prefix the attribute with a '-'
For example: ?sort=-createdAt

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Allow to receive partial response by specifying a list of attributes separed by a comma. The 'content' attribute is by default not returned.
Example: ?fields=name,type,content

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: If the href to a linked resource must be displayed or not.

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: If the name to a linked resource must be displayed or not.

X-Total-Count.description: The total number of items matching criterias.

X-Result-Count.description: The actual number of items returned in the response body.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Orange Identifier of the attachment

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

schema.description: Content of the file in binary mode.

get.summary: Provide the status of the API
get.description: This method allows to get the status of the components of the Incident Management API

get.summary: Provide the version of the API
get.description: This method provides detailed information on the API (Version/patch...)

major.description: Major number of the API version

minor.description: Minor number of the API version

patch.description: Patch number of the API version

deprecated.description: Flag indicating if the API is deprecated

get.description: This endpoint provides information on the connected user.

parameters.name: X-API-Key
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

HyperlinkMethod.description: HTTP verb used for the link.

ContactSupport.description: the preferred method to contact the individual

infoURL.description: URI on more information on the error

IncidentNote.description: List of Notes otes associated to the Incident.

createdAt.description: Date of the creation of the note

Attachment.description: List of files attached to the Incident.

type.description: Extension of the file such ..png; .txt, .zip, etc...

size.description: Size in octets of the file.

href.description: URI on the content of the file.

createdAt.description: Date of the publication of the file

content.description: Content of the file in Base64

id.description: Incident number, it is an unique id for identifying the incident. **This ID is managed by Orange Business Services**

customerReference.description:
Customer Reference of the incident. Allow to indicate, the Incident number of a third party Incident Management system. 
This can be set via the POST method or updated via the PATCH method.

status.description: Status of the incident. Available values are NEW for the creation, **IN_PROGRESS**, ON_HOLD

impact.description: Impact level of the current incident.

type.description: Type of the incident, support only FAILURE

origin.description: Root of the creation of the incident by Customer, Probes or Orange Staff).

shortDescription.description: Short description of the incident. Information provided at the opening of the Incident.

description.description: Detailed description of the incident. Information provided at the opening of the Incident.

escalationLevel.description: Indicate the level of the escalation of the incident. If the value is null, the ticket is not in escalation mode.

onHoldReason.description: Information on the reason of the onhold status.

openedAt.description:
Date when the ticket has been created. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

detectedAt.description:
Date when the issue has been detected. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

committedAt.description:
Date when the ticket must be fixed. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

closedAt.description:
Date when the ticket is closed. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

archivedAt.description:
Date when the ticket has been archived in our system.Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

escalatedAt.description:
Date of the current secalation. If no escalation in progress the attribute is null. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the Configuration Item.

reference.description: Orange Reference of the Configuration Item.

customerReference.description: Customer Reference of the Configuration Item.

closureSummary.description: Information on the closure of the Incident.

reason.description: Note of Orange Staff set at the closure of the incident. This field is available only when the incident is closed.

isCauseRoot.description: Flag indicating if the issue is the cause root of the trouble.

responsible.description: Indicate the responsible entity if Customer or Orange.

closedAt.description:
Date when the ticket has been closed.
Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

createdAt.description:
Date of the Incident has been created in the system. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date of the Incident has been updated the last time in the system. Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

Location.description: Location where the issue has been detected.

name.description: Name of the building, company etc..

extendedStreet.description: Letter of the street or extensions such as bis, ter.

id.description: Orange Single identifier of a contact (Individual)

name.description: Full name of the contact (First name + last name)

mobile.description: Mobile phone number of the contact

id.description: Orange Single identifier of a contact (Individual)

name.description: Full name of the Author (First name + last name)

status.description: "ok" if the service is functional (not taking into account the components health), "ko" if something is wrong (missing configuration data, database is down...)

version.description: API version (major dot minor dot patch numbers).

ConfigurationItemPOST.description: If you want to report an incident on an Equipment, product, you must provide at least one of these attributes.

reference.description: Orange Reference of the configuration Item.

customerReference.description: Customer Reference of the configuration Item.

id.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

IncidentNotePOST.description: Attributes required to post a new Incident Note.

IncidentPOST.description: Attributes to provide for reporting an incident.

customerReference.description: Reference of the incident can be freely updated. Allow to indicate, the Incident number of a third party Incident Management system.

urgency.description: Level of the urgency of the trouble

impact.description: Level of the impact of the trouble

shortDescription.description: Short description of the incident. Information provided at the opening of the Incident.

description.description: Detailed description of the incident. Information provided at the opening of the Incident.

FreezePeriods.description: List of Freeze Periods declared on the Incident.

id.description: single identifier of the freeze period. The last number indicate the number of freeze period.

startedAt.description: Start date fo the freeze period.

endedAt.description: End date of the freeze period.

duration.description: Duration in minutes of the freeze Period.

ME.title: Me
ME.description: Information on the connected user and the API Key.

id.description: Single Identifier of the API key.

phone.description: Phone number of the associated user.

mobile.description: Mobile number of the associated user.

email.description: Email address of the associated user.

scopes.description: Scopes defined for the API Key for Machine to Machine connection, or negotiated scopes for User to Machine connection.

type.description: Type of the environment (Sandbox or Production)

application.description: Application identifier in Orange Developer Portal.

token.description: Token identifier associated to the API Key.

createdAt.description: Date of the creation of the API Key.

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the API Key.

expiredAt.description: Expiration Date of the API Key.

Event.description: Proactive Event having created the incident

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the Event.

createdAt.description:
Date when the event has been trigged.  Use the [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_.

ServicePointPOST.description: Service Point where the incident is detected. If you want to report an incident on a Service Point, you must specified one of these attributes.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the Service Point.

customerReference.description: Customer Reference of the Service Point.

ServicePoint.description: Service Point where the incident is detected

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the Service Point.

customerReference.description: Customer Reference of the Service Point.

ServiceLevelManagement.description: Information on the Service Level Management.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Service Level Management.

coverageTime.description: Coverage Time of the Service Level Management.

restoreTime.description: Restore Time of the Service Level Management.

responseTime.description: Response Time of the Service Level Management.

IncidentPath.description: Only the Customer Reference can be updated on an Incident Object.

scopes.b2b:incident:readOnly: Read Access to Incident for Business API
scopes.b2b:incident: Full Access to Incident for Business API
